We are looking for a Tax Assistant that will directly supports the Global Tax Director with tax compliance, research, planning, provisions, and audits. This position manages Israeli direct and indirect tax compliance on a monthly, quarterly, and annual basis. Responsibilities will include reconciliations, calculations, document preparation and filing, as well as maintaining matrices. Also responsible for some aspects of international tax compliance management and reporting.
Reporting & Compliance
Responsible for completion of income tax returns work papers including all related analysis.
Responsible for completion CbC and MF report work papers including all related analysis
Prepares income tax accounting records and reports in accordance with applicable tax accounting practices, including analysis of Uncertain Tax Positions.
Tax consulting & Audits
Assist to manage audits conducted by local / external financial auditors and tax authorities (Income tax, WHT, Payroll tax, VAT).
Assist payroll group, as needed, to understand payroll tax matters on a global basis
Tax planning & Strategy
Prepares spreadsheets to assist with understanding global tax impacts related to business expansion, re-structuring and general planning matters
Assists with research of income tax considerations on a transactional basis
Assist the management in estimating and monitoring annual cash taxes.
Tax Accounting
Assist with accounting for income taxes (SFAS No. 109 / IAS12).
Prepares tax footnote, including quarterly disclosures
Prepares income tax accounting records and reports in accordance with applicable tax accounting practices, including analysis of Uncertain Tax Positions (UTPs)
Maintains all income tax accounting balances and schedules
Ensuring that appropriate internal controls are in place over accounting for income taxes.

5 years as a Certified CPA – BIG4

What you will get from us
Eaton’s mission is to improve the quality of life and the environment through the use of power management technologies and services. We provide sustainable solutions that help our customers effectively manage electrical, hydraulic and mechanical power – more safely, more efficiently and more reliably. Making what matters work at Eaton takes the passion of every employee around the world. We create an environment where creativity, invention and discovery become reality, each day. It’s where bold, bright professionals like you can reach your full potential—and where you can help us reach ours. Eaton’s 2020 revenues were $17.9 billion, and we sell products to customers in more than 175 countries. We have approximately 85,000 employees.
We make work exciting, engaging and meaningful for our employees through our dedication to tackling some of the toughest power management challenges on the planet and by never losing sight of what matters. Our culture is built on a strong commitment to practicing our core values and supporting our employees with the tools they need to succeed. We pledge to always foster a diverse and inclusive environment, including inclusion resource groups that bring together employees who share a common purpose, interest or background. In the past year, our company has received top employment recognition by the Human Rights Campaign and almost fifty percent of our Board of Directors represented diverse groups. When we embrace the different ideas, perspectives and backgrounds that make each of us unique, we — as individuals and as a company — are stronger.
We have demonstrated our passion for sustainability with the recent announcement of cutting carbon emissions from the company’s operations by at least 50 percent by 2030. We are ethical, passionate, accountable, efficient, transparent and committed to learning. We are confident we can deliver on our promise to improve the quality of life and the environment because of the attributes that our employees embody.
We are committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Junior Operations Associate
About Candex

Candex is a rapidly growing fintech player in the B2B payments market, which is one of the hottest markets in technology. Our solution is used by the Global 2000 to pay vendors in 30+ countries, fast & compliantly - clients include brands like 3M, Starbucks, Dell, Pfizer, Danone, L'Oréal, HSBC, Roche, Colgate, and many others. We have a world-class management team and $37m in funding from investors like Amex, JP Morgan, Altos, NFX, and Partech. As a member of our company, you will have a golden opportunity to reshape and impact how the biggest companies in the world manage a meaningful part of their business.

The company is growing rapidly, and we seek a Junior Operations Associate. This position will report to the VP of Operations. This is an opportunity to join the Candex Finance team and make a significant impact at a rapidly growing multinational fintech company.

The Role

This is a key role in delivering supreme support and service to our customers. You will be a valuable resource throughout the payment process and a crucial point of contact for our customers. If you have excellent interpersonal and communication expertise, strong writing and analytical skills and a desire to leverage your knowledge of fintech and payments; this opportunity is a perfect fit.


Responsibilities:

Handle day to day customer email/phone support related to the entire payment process.
Provide guidance to new customers to ensure they are on-boarded successfully.
Administer pending payments and registrations.
Work with customers to correct payment details provided or to obtain any missing information.
Send out client invoices ensuring they are accurate and compliant.
Review customer invoices received ensuring their accuracy and timeliness.
Reconcile bank payments received against invoices.
Prepare bank transfers and ensure that customer bank details are verified.
Verify customer data by performing compliance checks.

Requirements:

Undergraduate Bachelor's degree in economics/finance/accounting is preferred.
Fluent English language skills – written and verbal – a must.
Fintech/Hi-tech experience is preferred.
Able to accommodate global working hours - Mon-Thurs 11am-7pm, Fri 10am-5pm.
Impressive interpersonal and communication skills.
Strong computer skills with advanced Excel skills.
Outstanding attention to detail, with an ability to spot numerical errors.
Highly organized with the ability to multitask and work under pressure.
Tech savvy and the ability to pick up new technology quickly.Show more Report
